name: Disneyland
funFact: Disneyland was the first-ever Disney theme park and was personally overseen by Walt Disney.

name: Universal Studios Hollywood
funFact: The park features real working movie sets and studio tours.

name: Epcot
funFact: Epcot stands for 'Experimental Prototype Community of Tomorrow.'

name: Tokyo Disneyland
owner: The Oriental Land Company (under license from Disney)
funFact: It was the first Disney theme park to be built outside the United States.

name: Europa-Park
funFact: Europa-Park is the largest theme park in Germany and features 13 European-themed areas.

name: Lotte World
funFact: Lotte World is home to the world's largest indoor theme park.

name: Alton Towers
funFact: The park was built on the grounds of a former country estate and features historic gardens.

name: PortAventura World
funFact: PortAventura is one of the most visited theme parks in Europe and includes a Ferrari Land park.

name: Ocean Park
funFact: Ocean Park combines a marine mammal park, amusement rides, and a zoo in one location.

name: Gardaland
funFact: Gardaland is the most popular theme park in Italy and features attractions inspired by fantasy and adventure.

name: Shanghai Disneyland
owner: Shanghai Shendi Group (57%) and The Walt Disney Company (43%)
funFact: Shanghai Disneyland's castle, Enchanted Storybook Castle, is the largest Disney castle ever built.

name: Busch Gardens
funFact: Busch Gardens combines world-class roller coasters with a massive zoo featuring over 200 animal species.

name: Disneyland Paris
funFact: Disneyland Paris is the most visited theme park in Europe and features Sleeping Beauty's Castle as its centerpiece.

name: Tivoli Gardens
funFact: Tivoli Gardens is one of the oldest amusement parks in the world and inspired Walt Disney to create Disneyland.
